Reviews.Title: “A sleepover hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elvira P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a few times this year. Very convenient to Los Angeles Airport, rooms are nice if you get a remodeled room but please do not expect a soft pillow, they are like rocks! I am taking my own pillow with me lately. The shuttle service is spotty, it is not always every 15 or 20 minutes as they will tell you. Be patient and plan ahead if your time is tight. We will go back with our own pillows and allowing plenty of time to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Overnight”
Reviews.Author: Pottsy747
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and handy to LAX. airport pick-up was too slow but that's the only criticism. Breakfast just fair.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: 50opd2j
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK stay, the rooms were clean and tidy though we were told we had to pay extra on arrival after we had already paid on booking through the internet, we were told it didn't include extra persons though when we booked we clearly had a room for 4.It was a late check in we were all tired and just wanted to go to our rooms so we just paid as they didn't want to come to an agreement. parking fees were ok. McDonalds is just out the front of the hotel. close to the airport but thats about it

Reviews.Title: “Good on price, location, and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: grandpere
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel whenever I travel to LA to visit family. I have always had a good stay. The rooms are comfortable as are the beds. Wifi is free as are the two computers in the small business center--perfect for printing your boarding pass for the airport. The free breakfast is the best and most complete of any hotel I've stayed in. The hotel is generally pretty well booked so make a reservation early.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rest and very convienent to LAX”
Reviews.Author: akbecky
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay in January. We had planned on going out to Hollywood Blvd, but were too tired and decided to stay in for the night. We were in need of a drink so right next door was a 7-11 where we picked up a six pack to quench our thirst. There was also a bistro right next to the hotel so we ate there. It was good food, but nobody else was in there. It was Sat night so I guess people went more downtown for fancier places. The hotel was very clean and even though only one elevator was working, it was hardly a wait. The shuttle was timely and so convienent. The beds were great! After a week in Mexico on hard matresses, it was a dream come true.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with decent amenities”
Reviews.Author: klspac
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying, I am a travel agent and was traveling with my better half hubby. Even though our room was upgraded because of being an agent, but I would still feel confident sending my clients here for a short term stay near LAX. We had no trouble finding the HIE, since the hertz rental car agency which we used was essentially right around the corner. It is an off the airport property hotel though and seemed to be close enough to LAX proper to use it as a quick night stopover, yet far enough that the planes were not flying 500 ft. overhead. The lobby was clean and bright with helpful staff, willing to fix incorrect name spellings and info., with no quams. Even received water bottles and granola bars upon check-in. Simple gift/sundries shop off lobby was a nice touch. Elevators, however, were relatively slow...maybe they need to be upgraded, not sure. Our room was clean with ample amt of space to move around and place your bags. Bed was a bit on the firm side, but since that's supposed to be better for your back, no complaints here, as I felt good in the morning. Since our room was a suite, there was separate living area with pull out sofa bed, chair, cocktail table, tv, and wet bar sink/fridge (empty). Sink area of bathroom was open, between the living and bed areas, and a large tub & toilet were behind a door. The room offered two types of pillows, each labeled firm and soft. The complimentary bath amenities were of decent quality and smelled fantastic. One downfall was that, of the two outlets at the sink area, one did not work. No biggie, just used the second one. Flat screen tv's were the standard here and there was a simple alarm clock. We arrived fairly late in the evening, so I cannot say much for the hotel's other common areas. Walked past a relatively small 24 hr fitness ctr with you basic cardio equipment (treadmill, bike, elliptical,etc). Hotel did have free wifi, and the code and password was given with your room key, however, I did have difficulty using it in our room, but that was likely an ipad issue I was dealing with. Complimentary breakfast was suprisingly nice with a decent spread. Coffee station, automatic pancake maker (never seen such a contraption before...cool!), cinnamon rolls, cereal, eggs/sausage/gravy, toaster for bread, eng. muffins bagels, a cooler with milk, reg and lite yogurts, cream cheese and hard boiled eggs, and a juice dispenser with at least 4 options. The free breakfast was continually be re -stocked and refreshed by staff and there was plenty of seating. Check out was quick, as they slide you receipt and final charges under the door of your room overnight. Did not seem to be a whole lot of parking available, but they assured us we could park overnight in their 20 minute only parking spots. Like I stated earlier, I would have no problem sending my clients here for a short term stay (1-2 nights) that was so convenient to LAX. Hope this helps make your decision a little easier.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: Jjoohhnnssoonn
Reviews.Content: Good choice for those wanting clean, safe stay near LAX. 24 hour shuttle and many choices at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: MJRAust
Reviews.Content: Small room, but very clean. Great for short stopover. Free shuttle service (make sure you catch the bus to exress though, as we caught wrong bus to other Holiday Inn !). Hotel recommended dinner options, many stores nearby for dinner or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, depending on your needs...”
Reviews.Author: rodrigt
Reviews.Content: For the modest price that includes free internet and breakfast this place is a great value! This is not the place for someone requiring a hotel restaurant and/or nearby bars & dining. For me it is a great place to stay near LAX; right around the corner from a 24 Hr Seven-Eleven for snacks/beer/wine and a couple of small restaurant joints within three blocks. Their shuttle from/to LAX runs every 30 minutes (no need to call) and the drivers are most helpful loading/unloading the luggage. Upon request they can arrange for a car & driver if you need. If you have a free day they have all the necessary info for getting picked-up by (fixed price) transportation services to to the Getty Museum and other LA attractions. What prompted me to write this review is the delightful friendliness of everyone on their staff! This place is a great value, depending on your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in sketchy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: paula_eyler
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was fine: clean, well furnished. The staff were great - very helpful and efficient. The airport shuttle was great. The only downside is that the hotel is not in a good neighbourhood, not one I would choose to go for a walk in, or go outside in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for short stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: MikeBracknell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a two night stopover on route to New Zealand. Clean and comfortable and good value. Breakfast was the usual 'continental' with the addition of bacon, sausages and scrambled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. Way Beneath HIE's Usual Standards”
Reviews.Author: TMSHawaii
Reviews.Content: Terrible neighborhood. Hotel badly in need of renovation. I will never stay there again. There are plenty of hotels on Century Blvd (around the corner) which are much, much nicer for only a few bucks more. Elevators are beat up, rooms are not up to the usual HIE standard. Rooms have a weird layout with a bathroom door that swings outward and collides with the main room door. "Business Desk" was awful with a clear glass top which rendered my mouse useless. The phone on the desk did not work. Poor selection of power outlets. Worst of all, I came out of my room at about 6AM to find a homeless man asleep on the 6th floor landing next to the elevators. This hotel is in a nasty neighborhood, the elevators should be room-key protected! I am a football lineman-sized guy so the vagrant didn't bother me all that much, I can handle myself. But I would never recommend this place to a female or a person who is at all concerned about security. I am a Priority Club Gold Elite member, I got onto the PC web site and complained about what a dump this place is.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay for two nights, booked 2 rooms”
Reviews.Author: alastairdeacon
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 of his employees needed to go to UCLA for some continuing ed classes. This hotel is about a 20 minute drive down the 405 fwy and about a quarter of the cost of hotels in the Westwood area. Check in was easy and we had a pleasant young man, Neely, go over everything very efficiently. Found us rooms near each other, confirmed bed type and he mentioned a Persian restaurant just around the corner. The room was clean, comfortable bed, free wifi, free parking. While the area is not one I'd walk around in a lot at night (not scenic, mostly safe) we had no problem walking over to the Persian restaurant, called Pers in the little strip mall right around the corner. Cute place. White linen tablecloths, leather banquettes, excellent food, warm, welcoming staff. We are vegetarians and there was plenty of choices for us and even more for our meat eating friends. The menu was comprehensive and also included pizzas, they seemed to share space with Jinos, and we saw lots of people taking to-go boxes. Neely, the front office clerk, had also mentioned that if we showed them our room key, there would be a 15% discount. When we asked the waiter, he very cheerfully acknowledged the deal. This place is a find. We also noticed right nearby there's a Sizzler and a 7-11 where we stopped for a bottle of wine. Good choice for us and we will be back for the next session of classes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but no quarters!”
Reviews.Author: tonestar24
Reviews.Content: I had just finished a 2 week tour and was flying out of LAX the next morning to Vancouver, so staying here was a perfect solution. There was a free shuttle to LAX and with Holiday Inn I knew I was staying in a nice hotel. The room was very nice, it was quiet and just what I needed after a long bus ride. What I didn't need was a problem with getting my laundry done. I hadn't washed in a week so I had a fair amount to do obviously, and was excited that this hotel had laundry facilities on site, which weren't old but modern, when I checked them out. I only had $1.50 in quarters and needed about $4 to wash and dry the one load. The only problem was the hotel didnt have any quarters anywhere!!! How can you have a coin operated machine without atleast a bunch of quarters kept aside for guests? Normally I would just wave it off as unfortunate, but considering it is an LAX hotel they are always busy and people will want to do their laundry more so in a hotel here than anywhere. I said this to the girl, so I am not just writing it here without showing my dissatisfaction at the time about what was happening. This wasn't my real issue with them though, because considering i am a 26 year old girl from Australia, who was traveling alone (luckily a guy from my tour was staying there too coincidentally, as i bumped into him in the lobby), so he came with me on my quest to go everywhere from McDonald's (didn't have any), to gas stations and other hotels next door just to get the amount that was needed. It was 9pm at this stage and dark outside, so making me walk around at night to find quarters not only annoyed me but shouldn't be happening in any case, especially in an area that is kind of questionable at night. Overall, it was a nice stay there. I enjoyed the room and was able to relax once my washing was done, which is why I rated it a 3 and not lower. BUT if they are going to continue to use coin operated anything at this hotel, having quarters really needs to be a priority so no one else has to walk around at night just so they can do their laundry! Stay here if you know you won't be doing laundry, but if you are then make sure you have at least $5 worth on you. It is a nice place, just a pity the service and help was lacking on this particular stay.

Reviews.Title: “My Go To Hotel for an early flight from LAX”
Reviews.Author: BizTravellers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to get to and has easy parking. I live about an hour from LAX, which is closer to 3 hours on a Monday morning. I always find the staff to be pleasant and the room is always clean. The airport is a couple miles from the airport, which allows them to keep their prices down a little. The also offer extended parking if you just want to leave your car there and take a shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Quick and Convenient for LAX”
Reviews.Author: brantosl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night after arriving late at LAX. It is nothing fancy but exactly what you would expect from Holiday Inn Express. Clean, comfortable rooms and a decent free breakfast in the morning (I particularly liked the pancake machine that rolls out a hot fresh pancake on a conveyor belt in 1 min. Fun!) Free WI-FI and a welcome bag with a bottle of water and granola bar in it were nice touches! There is a pool (we didn't use it...not sure if it's heated) that is right beside the parking lot. My only concern is that it was pretty noisy and I'm not usually sensitive to noise but I certainly noticed. We were in a room that faced the street so maybe ask for one on the other side?

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic!”
Reviews.Author: Clermont_Cowgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay at briefly after a long haul flight from Australia, just so we could shower and nap to ease the jet lag. Firstly, they cancelled our room as a no show, even though we put a note on our booking that we wouldn't be arriving until early morning. They finally gave us a room - the worst one in the hotel probably. The shower didn't work at all and I could barely get any hot water to have a bath. The staff were offhand, nearly to the point of being rude, but maybe this is just an LA thing? The only saving grace was the room had full blockout curtains, so we could sleep. If you want a room after a long haul flight, I would pay a bit more and stay somewhere decent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: ArchiBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My first impression with my night time arrival was " Oh no! What have I booked?" This was perhaps influenced by the back road approach as the shuttle picked up people from a car park and the external and lobby lighting on arrival was not great. My view changed quickly because of the fast check in and the service, particularly from the shuttle driver who quickly unloaded my bags and took them up to my room which had wifi. Morning light showed the lobby to be a pleasant place with a small shop, business room and lounge with a big TV screen. My room on the top floor was clean and comfortable with a king sized bed, and a bathroom that appeared to have been renovated not that long ago and was one of the cleanest I've seen in such hotels. The room size was fine for up to two people. As I paid $75 per night I was surprised to find that this price included breakfast. There was a good range of food and it was presented neatly. Two points to note : the hotel runs its own shuttle to and from the airport. It is supposed to run each way twice per hour leaving from the hotel on the hour and half hour but this is not always the case. I had to wait 55 minutes for one at the airport end. Secondly, you cannot get food other than breakfast at the hotel unless you order a delivery. There are eating places a short walk away so you could ask reception for advice about this. I have stayed at several LAX hotels and would choose this smaller one again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: OurGrandDayOut
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with two children. Rooms were clean enough, but everything about this hotel is tired, including the staff. Location was poor - only fast food was in walking distance. Breakfast was very basic, and eaten with plastic flatware and cutlery. We wouldn't stay here again. Recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Newark Airport - and it demonstrated how good an airport HInn can be for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: misspipkelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (on points) for one night during a layover at LAX and it was very convenient and had everything we needed. We arrived late via the free shuttle (a little wait for this at the airport terminal) and our only complaint would probably be that there was no nearby restaurant, but there was a selection of delivery menus in the room. The bed was comfortable, the noise didn't bother us which I know had been a problem for some previous reviewers but we didn't really hear the planes. We didn't use any of the amenities but there is a pool and small gym. Free wifi and complimentary breakfast were both appreciated! Room was big and clean. Perfect airport stop over - doubt anyone would stay here not connected to catching a flight but for that it did the job well!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: groofan
Reviews.Content: We reserved our rooms in this hotel so as to be close to our family for Thanksgiving. As we were checking in my wife noticed a sign saying we had been chosen as guests of the day. We were given complementary upgrades into a suite because of this. The location was perfect for us. It was a quick and easy drive to resturants, shopping centers and yes, our family. If you happen to be flying in or out of LA they have two shuttle buses that run around the clock. While the free breakfast bars in Holiday Inns seem to be pretty much alike, this one stood out. The attendent was constantly attending to the foods when they ran low and I never saw a dirty unoccupied table while we were there. They now have fresh pancakes made while you wait rather than the preprepared ones on the hot line. The staff made us feel at home and our maid made it a point to say good morning to us every morning. We would have give them a 5.0 but they were experiencing elevator problems for the entire time we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: linda1066
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in October to break my journey from America to England. We arrived at the hotel at about 8am in the morning after a long flight. Our room wasn't ready (wasn't expecting it to be that early so it wasn't a problem) but we were told to go and help ourselves to breakfast and housekeeping would get the room ready ASAP. This was great service, as technically were weren't eligible for breakfast till the following morning. Once we got into the room and had a rest, the bell desk arranged a tour for the following day (we had a late flight) and were offered a ride to the bus stop so we could go to the mall, and to phone when we were ready to be picked up. This was another great service offered by the hotel. Some other things to note: Food wise - breakfast was great with lots of options. For dinner etc. there is a sizzler next door, Denny's, burger king and a couple of other places are bit further down W. Manchester Ave (turn right at the corner). The hotel is a bit isolated being at the far end of airport boulevard. I probably wouldn't walk the streets at night, but for service and value would have no problems staying here again!! The staff were wonderful, friendly and the beds were comfortable and the shower was hot. Really, what more do you need for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Restaurant, Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Halu C
Reviews.Content: When you arrive in LA airport, there are several terminals but is relatively easy to travel. You need to walk out from the terminal. Just outside the terminal, there are bus-stops. Look for bus-stop with a Red color sign board if you want o take free shuttle bus service to your respective hotels. Waiting time will not be more than 15-20 minutes. Holiday-Inn LA is only about 5 mins ride from the airport. I stayed in this hotel for only one day but my impression on this hotel was good. The staff seem knowledgeable on recommending places to visit. The in house restaurant serve good food with reasonable price. There is also a gift shop near the restaurant. If you are traveling on budget, there are some fast food restaurants just outside the hotel. MacDonalds is just next hotel. The Hotel also organize day LA trip for busy travelers. Overall experience has been great. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice made”
Reviews.Author: Nancy Q
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience...I was a little worried because some of the reviews but it was a great deal. Breakfast was really good, fruitsm bagels, eggs, yougurth, cereales, pancakes, muffins, juice, milk, bacon, pretty much everything you need. Service was great! The manager who recieved us at night was really friendly and welcome. Thanks a lot btw Christian!!! He was so nice, told us where to park and everything. The rooms were pretty clean and everything was perfect. Totally recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn LAX - Easy to acccess at the right Price”
Reviews.Author: viator1
Reviews.Content: For the price you will find on Orbitz or Hotels.com - you get a little more than what you pay for...Free internet and the beds are clean and comfortable. The bathrooms need a face lift - but they are functional. I wouldn't recommend the restaurant at all. The McDonald's next door is better. Over all - I would stay here again on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBTraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently had a layover in LA and chose the Holiday Inn Express LAX. The hotel is in a good location, close to the airport, but not so close as to have excessive noise issues. There is a free shuttle to pick you up from / take you back to LAX that runs every 1/2 an hour, but note that at night you need to call for a pickup (I found this out the hard way after a 1/2 an hour wait!). The rooms are large, well equipped and very clean. The hotel provides free internet access, and throw in a free breakfast as well. Breakfast is a pretty good selection considering the rate you are paying, and it's free! The location is great with a 7/11 and Sizzler downstairs, as well as a Denny's, Burger King and Subway a couple of blocks walk. It has the slowest lift known to man, so if you are on a timetable to get the airport shuttle make sure you leave enough time for the lift to get you to the ground floor! Highly recommended if you need to stay overnight near LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre accomodations”
Reviews.Author: zoo260
Reviews.Content: A lumpy mattress and painfully slow elevators await you at the HI Express LAX. The rooms are recently renovated but it feels like they are using the old mattresses. The elevators are so slow you are not sure if you are moving at times. The treadmills in the gym are on the cheaper end as well. Overall this property is a cut below other HI Expresses I have stayed at. I do not expect much when I need a crash pad by the airport for a couple of nights but this place was a cut below. I will try other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you need to stay at near LAX”
Reviews.Author: IHorsfield
Reviews.Content: We had one night after arriving in LAX late, we were happy with this hotel, reception may be a little uninteresting and basic, but the room was large clean and comfortable, the bathroom was again very clean and functional. A functional and pleasant enough hotel giving good value for money. Recomended

Reviews.Title: “Good LAX location”
Reviews.Author: jsolt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our transatlantic flight. Hotels is close to several rental car agencies, a sizzler is around the corner, next shopping is 5 minutes by car. We used the hotel as a three day base touring Santa Monica, Manhattan Beach, Beverly Hills and LA downtown. By car, you're quick quite everywhere. Parking and internet are free of charge, staff is nice. We were upgraded to a suite due to Platinum status with Priority Club rewards, which was a very nice, spacious room including a fridge for some drink. As always at HI Express, breakfast was complimentary which is nothing special but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a Night, Best Value for Close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: I rarely fly in/out of LAX on business, choosing usually one of the other LA-area airports, so I had no familiarity of hotels near LAX. With an early flight out of LAX, I found this one thanks to other Trip Advisor Reviews and for the most part I would recommend it. Only about a mile from LAX, so easy to return a rental car and the hotel has a free shuttle but I didn't use it. Plenty of parking (free). This is a former Howard Johnson (according to a long-term guest) that has been completely refurbed with modern decor into an HI Express. The only thing they didn't do apparently was the elevators which are old, very slow and as of this writing one was still out of order, so expect a potentially long wait to go up and down. I didn't have any issues with airplane noise (none) or street noise (not much, drowned out by a/c and fan) and the room was quiet and I didn't hear other guests. The neighborhood is dodgy but didn't feel unsafe, although I wouldn't go walking around after dark. Hotel was fine, completely safe, lots of families and overseas tourists staying there. 7-11 in front of the hotel if you need supplies and a Sizzler steakhouse also in front. But if you want any nice restaurants or shopping you either need a car or line up the hotel's shuttle. If I was going to fly in/out of LAX again, I would stay here because it's a lot more affordable than the large airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: Martin334
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express at LAX is an airport hotel, would think that +80% of guests are in between flights. So, a good frequent shuttle is pretty essential. I got pretty upset having to wait 45 minutes and 2 phone calls to the front desk on arrival ("he's leaving now") to get picked up by the airport shuttle, and then made a detour to a rental car lot.....one of two elevators was out of service for two days and the other one halfbroken.....fitness room not cleaned and safety pins broken.... On the positive side, large modern room, fast free internet, breakfast included, good staff, good rate. In summary, could be a great low budget airport hotel but maintenance sloppy and shuttle operation pulls it down to a mixed/average place.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT FOR AN OVERNIGHT”
Reviews.Author: MGBIndonesia
Reviews.Content: I did not have to wait long for the hotel shuttle; check-in was efficient. Although the entrance and lobby are underwhelming, my room turned out to be everything I could hope for: attractive, immaculate, and well supplied with everything a guest could possibly need. Although the window air conditioner was a bit noisy, the fabulous bed more than compensated. Free, high-speed internet connection, big-screen TV, generous lighting, even a desk chair adjustable for height! Add to all this very reasonable rates, especially if prepaid in advance. Absolutely I will stay here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here it is a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Marion T
Reviews.Content: It started with them not having our booking which we had already paid for. The male receptionist was arrogant & rude he was making threatening remarks instead of trying to help us. Then they put us in a room that was dirty. Amazingly the night duty manger rang us & helped us go move to the suite that we had paid for ..he was the best thing about the place. It smells dirty, rooms are not clean & lifts don't work ....disasterous

Reviews.Title: “Noisy air conditioner + only one functional elevator”
Reviews.Author: coconutfan2010
Reviews.Content: Check-in process: Fast and easy. Room: The air conditioner was noisy and I had to wear ear plugs throughout the night. The room was rather stuffy. The room was overall pretty spacious. There was a small refridgerator and a microwave. Hallway: Had the odor of an old building. Breakfast: Hot breakfast on the first floor with scrambled eggs, breakfast biscuit and sausages. Pastries and bread available. No pancake or waffle maker. Internet: OK TV: HBO available Parking: Free for guests Other: There was only one elevator that was working the entire time we were there. The elevator was really slow and the wait seemed like forever. Overall: The stay was okay except for the single working elevator that was very slow and the noisy air conditioner.

Reviews.Title: “Additional charge for room”
Reviews.Author: Barwen
Reviews.Content: Error made by booking agent for accommodation for 30 and 31 August. Was booked for 29 and 30 August instead. Hotel manager would not consider transferring payment (which he already had) to the correct dates and insisted I pay an additional USD$125 for the extra day. His disparaging remarks included that we 'could stay in the same room'. He stated that he could have re-allocated the room to another traveller. This charge even though the hotel was (according to staff) only one third full. Not a satisfactory outcome and we won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “what a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowEsta
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three week trip to the Usa stayed at this hotel at the start and end of my holiday, this hotel has lovely staff, is very clean, provides free parking and gives you a lovely breakfast free of charge it is only 15 mins at most to the beach a great chill out before returning home the small pool area is very clean and well kept, some of the Crown Plaza hotel staff could learn some customer service tips from the staff at this hotel. Well done to the Manager and Staff.....Mr and Mrs Burns

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & near LAX”
Reviews.Author: annhMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed and we stayed here for one night prior to our return to OZ. There is a courtesy pick up & drop off to LAX - about 15 minutes away. Good prompt regular service with polite & helpful drivers. The hotel was pleasant and the room was comfortable and clean - with a huge bed! We had a complimentary breakfast as part of our deal , and it was excellent . Full American hot breakast served by courteous friendly staff. Internet access is available - but a touch pricey. We extended our check out time to coincide with an evening departure time from LAX . This only cost a few extra dollars , but was so worth it , as it meant we could shower immediately before a 16 hour flight , and not have to sit around all day waiting . There's a McDonalds close by , but unsure of how safe the area around the hotel is - we were there on a Sunday and it seemed quiet - a bit isolated actually , so we made the most of the big flat screen TV in our room - it was the end of our trip after all - and we were more than ready for some rest. Therefore we spent all our time there in the hotel or the room , and it was extremely pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet place”
Reviews.Author: PeteyCue
Reviews.Content: I was returning on 14 hour flight from Bangkok. There was a bit of a wait for the shuttle pick up at LAX. But the hotel was close by. Shuttle left on time the next morning. for my flight back home to New Orleans. The room was spotless and quiet. I am going to Bali next February through LAX and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for airport departure”
Reviews.Author: Chevy76
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed herein July one night prior to leaving via LAX early in the morning at the end of our California vacation (Yosemite to Simi Valley to Santa Monica). The location is ideal for the price. If you want to be closer to the airport prepare to pay a lot more. The hotel is located near several rental car return offices. I could have walked about 4 blocks back from the Enterprise return area (where we returned our car upon arrival). The room was nicely decorated, of average size. Elevators were slow, and the stairwell I chose did not go to the lobby--the bottom floor stairway exits outdoors and "alarm will sound" if opened, so don't bother try to bypass the elevators via stairs. Staff was nice at check in. We had 2 young children, so they were happy to swim in the pool. The pool is outdoor and would be in the parking lot but for a wall around it. you have to exit the hotel's main lobby doors and walk along the building a short distance to get to the pool, which is odd, but not a problem. Pool area was nice. There is a small hot tub which hits the spot after a long trip. Not a lot of chairs. It was not busy during our stay (Wednesday). They have 24 hour shuttle, which left on time and the driver was very experienced. He avoided the long traffic line at the entrance to LAX departure area by simply driving in the lower "arrival" area (which is all but vacant at 6am) and then taking a shortcut up to the departure area and got us to our airline in about 15 minutes. He helped load and unload bags promptly (earned his tip). When I was briefly out and about in the area around the hotel I was never concerned about safety. There is a 7 Eleven on the corner, and a Burger King nearby. Nothing stands out as exceptional, but there is no problems with this hotel. I thought the price was great for the location near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “All what you would ever need”
Reviews.Author: kabouzeid
Reviews.Content: yes its not a WOW 5star hotel, but if you are on a budget yet want to stay at a clean hotel, friendly staff. Although the bell man was rude, but other than that the rooms are clean, quiteâ€¦ you get to pay 12$ per night for parking, and yes you need to have a Car to get around, so better rent if you don't. the location is like in the center between disney and universal studios. so you just plan your day accordingly. also you can get a priority club card free of charge, and you might be upgraded to a bigger room :) mcdonalds is right under the hotel 24/7 also they have a self help laundry room, but its just one dryer and one washing machineâ€¦ enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great beds”
Reviews.Author: Timtam50
Reviews.Content: What do you need after a long flight - a great bed and quiet room and check in anytime . This is what we have found here several times , look no further . If you have time to kill a bus is available for Manhatten beach or Santa Monica area. Don't get excited about the food here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bowral
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Express seems to have adopted the philosophy of the fast food chains â€“ no matter where you are, you can expect much the same level of service and product anywhere around the world. The Holiday Inn Express LAX maintains the standard of service that weâ€™ve come to expect with helpful, courteous staff and a bright, clean, comfortable room which was also a good size. Breakfast, which was included in the tariff, was excellent with a wide range of hot and cold food available to cater for most tastes and there is internet access for those who require it. The hotel is only a five minute drive from LAX airport by free shuttle bus but unlike other hotels which run a regular service, you need to have the airport information desk ring the hotel to advise them that you require pick up. The return shuttle to the airport is available every 30 minutes from the hotel. The hotel is not particularly well located if you intend sightseeing around LA as it is quite some distance from Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Downtown, Santa Monica and the movie studios. However if you wish to take tours, VIP Tours, who conduct a full range of tours in and around LA, have a desk in the foyer where bookings can be made and they pick-up/drop-off from the hotel. There is also a small store in the hotel foyer and around the corner from the hotel is a Seven Eleven store/supermarket, a Sizzler restaurant and also a group of stores which includes a Bistro and dry cleaners. We enjoyed our stay and would be more than happy to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: mciufalo
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the end of a business trip because of the close proximity to LAX. They also offer a free shuttle. The hotel looked recently remodeled, with very nice rooms and free wifi. Even got a complimentary snack bag for being a priority club member.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnighter”
Reviews.Author: L8ON
Reviews.Content: Good Overnight Airport hotel, older design but clean and comfortable with very friendly and helpful staff. Price was good and we thought value for money, would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: grandpere
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a quick weekend trip to visit relatives. This was our third stay. Very popular with foreign visitors. Here are the pros and cons: Pro: Very convenient to LAX and 405 freeway; great free breakfast; good fitness center with two treadmills, one cycle and one elliptical; nice pool; free parking; good sized rooms. Con: Limited TV selections--no HD; lumpy pillows; very slow elevators (ask for a low room so you can use the stairs). All in all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: henry_spratt
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here overnight before leaving the USA, following a flight from New York. The shuttle bus to and from the airport was a good service and made transport easy. The room was very clean and comfortable and the beds were quite large. The staff were helpful and let us check out at a later time as our flight was at midnight. The hotel is close to a sizzler which made dinner cheap and easy. Wifi was available in our room and I experienced no significant lag or slowness. The included breakfast has lots of options. In all, a very good place to stay if you have a flight the next day, rather than a place to base yourself in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable-July 20 and July 24, 2011”
Reviews.Author: lans98
Reviews.Content: Both nights were pleasant. This hotel appears to be well maintained-(at least the room I stayed in was and the common areas were) The bedroom and the bathroom are spacious. No complaints for a night while en route to and from your destination. It is close to the airport and rental car companies. The Hotel Shuttle is available in a very timely manner. The breakfast was more than adequate (eggs, sausage- (pork & turkey), cereals, hard boiled eggs, juices, fruits, yogurts, biscuits & gravy, pancakes and a few more items. If the occasion arises where I need a hotel close to LAX airport, I wouldnâ€™t mind staying at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Scoooooter9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in May 2011. Would not recoomend this hotel to my worst enemy. Neighborhood is extremely violent and dangerous. I had my truck stolen from their parking lot, which the front desk manager had assured me was "totally safe" Might have been an inside job..as they have security staff on duty and video cameras. Hotel did little to help me even though I was stranded. Do not stay at this property...stay closer to the Airport. You are risking your life and property by choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for near the airpor”
Reviews.Author: issie58
Reviews.Content: booked one night at this hotel .Did not wait long for the shuttle at the airport ,staff very friendly ,room was clean and comfortable .very near shops and fast foods outlet .good location for 1 night

Reviews.Title: “Poor service all around”
Reviews.Author: capitola_traveler57
Reviews.Content: Confirmed a refrigerator was in the room when I secured the reservation only to discover there was none. When I spoke to the manager she was rude and not accomodating. She said maybe they could if I was willing to pay an extra ten dollars a night. The elevator is incredibly slow. Parking is free, however they have tiny compact slots. We called the second day for a clean set of towels and they never arrived. On the third day, a guest riding the elevator with us stated the hotel had been fumagated that day. I was alarmed since we had a baby with us. I again spoke with a manager who denied any fumigation (even though the front desk clerk told me it had been). The manager stated they had only sprayed the hallways with air freshener. Room was clean but the service was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: scholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our holiday. It was conveniently located with free shuttle buses to/from LAX airport which made it easy to get to and pick up our rental car the next morning. The room itself was clean and bigger than we were expecting- with two huge double-beds and plenty of space. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The free wi-fi did not pick up in our room, and the hair-dryer did not work. There were also only three towels for four people. This is definitely a no-frills overnight stop with it's convenient location to the airport, rather than a hotel to choose to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ReBroker1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with kids for a few days while seeing family in LA. The hotel was clean and the staff worked very hard to keep everything ship shape. Breakfast was very popular and there was pancakes, juices, coffee, eggs, yogurt, milk, etc. The manager was on premise regularly and made sure everything ran smoothly. Our room faced the approach to LAX and we saw planes landing regularly but from the room you heard no noise. Sitting pool side was a different story. The neighborhood was fine and the 7-11 on the corner was useful for snacks, wine and beer. Free Internet access, parking and newspapers, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: 214Solutions
Reviews.Content: The Only Hotel i found in LA (beach and lax area) with free parking, free internet, free breakfast, free aiport shuttle, security and had a 3 star rating.....only 2 problems...the 6th floor need a stronger a/c unit and the elevator is 3rd world slow.

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Access - Minimal Amenities”
Reviews.Author: JoeMiner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we had an early flight - for that it was perfect. They are in a neighborhood with other businesses but no shopping nearby. There is no restaraunt in the hotel, except they are a 1 minute walk to a McDonald's. So this is not a place to take your family or for a business meeting. They have a hotel shuttle to the airport which comes frequently so that is the only real amenity.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming, Economical, Well Situated and Practical”
Reviews.Author: dalpob
Reviews.Content: From the moment we landed at LAX from Melbourne I was thankful we had booked at Holiday Inn Express. We literally walked out of the airport door and straight onto the Hotel shuttle and were in our very comfortable $A90 double room in less than an hour. (Note though that you may need to use one of the free hotel phones located within the arrivals concourse to contact the hotel in order to get them to send out the shuttle if you arriving at an odd hour). The desk staff were amazingly efficient and professional. A well oiled check in/check out system and lots of local knowledge at hand. We were even able to use the airport shuttle (for free) to drop us at a central bus stop where we could take public transport all over LA on short excursions. This made our time in LA very pleasurable and easy --- something we had not counted on at all. The pool and spa are small but clean and well maintained: a welcome facility for those who suffer jet lag. The self serve breakfast, (polystyrene plates and plastic knives and forks) as mentioned elsewhere, is a bit of a let down ... but this is a minor deficiency when you are getting such outstanding value. The Wifi was excellent. Also a great little 7-11 behind the hotel where you can buy sushi, california rolls, salads and a good range of Californian wine very cheaply. There is also a Sizzlers "all-you-can-eat" at the same location for those with a serious appetite. Practical, economic and convenient options when you are tired and just off a 15 hour flight. Holiday Inn Express was well situated allowing you a problem free entry to and exit from an otherwise chaotic city. We will most certainly stay here again on our next rip to the Americas. Excellent management, service and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Recent
Reviews.Content: Great front desk staff, really felt welcome. Great breakfast, and quiet hotel. Will recommend to all Australians traveling to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the LAX location”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn8508
Reviews.Content: Old hotel property that HIE has taken over in the past few years. Lobby and rooms were in good condition. Elevators are a bit shaky, but make it to the 6th floor. Left for LAX too early for a the full breakfast. They had coffee and muffins out for the early risers. The airport shuttle runs every half hour. Took only 8 minutes to get to LAX and the driver knew the route and helped with the bags. If you are flying out early, you can't beat this HIE location. Price was right and room was clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: casolaro
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and close to LAX. Only hotel that offers long term parking for over 10 days. Staff was friendly, curious and helpful. Construction on the South side of the Hotel (as of June 13th) so ask for North side rooms if you want to sleep. Parking was close and convenient. Breakfast buffet was OK but fruit and veggies were not ripe. Get omelets instead, it was better and cheaper. I received a $20 credit certificate towards the breakfast when I checked in and that was a pleasant surprise. I was placed in a handicap room for some reason and the shower was difficult to figure out but a staff member came up quickly to assist. Thank you. At 1:30 AM, some idiot was sitting outside my door on the floor, talking on a cell phone while using an ipad. I had to go out there and ask him (not so kindly) to move away so I could sleep. He moved about 4 doors down and I could still hear him so I called security and the removed him. Not the fault of the hotel but worth the mention.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Music_Is_Viva
Reviews.Content: Not your typical holiday inn quality. Only reason it is surviving i believe is because of the close proximity to the airport. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To HI Express Standards”
Reviews.Author: Sanibelle1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated at LAX right near the airport and rental car returns. It is a little less expensive than some of the bigger hotels like Marriott, etc. but definitely not worth the price and you can do much better a few miles away. It is an old Howard Johnson's that has received a minimal facelift. The staff was very friendly but did nothing to fix the loud and annoying wind tunnel noise coming through the air conditioner vent or the message light that kept blinking all night on the telephones. The wind caused the door in the adjoining room to slam loudly whenever it was closed and our neighbor made more than a few trips to and from the room late in the evening. The plug used to charge your phone did not work, as I found out in the morning when my mobile phone had little battery life left. The safe, for which they charge a $1.50 daily fee, was out of order. The printer in the "business center" is very old and the computers are very slow and the "fitness center" is a joke. The only pluses besides the location were the bathrooms, which were new and clean, and the food in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient stopover”
Reviews.Author: VaderLondon
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about, but if you need a decent hotel at a reasonable price, close to LAX then this is a good option. The free shuttle arrived after about 10 minutes (you need to call the hotel first, so do it while waiting for your luggage) - then it is just a short drive away (The driver was helpful and courteous). The hotel looks a bit dated and the lifts (elevators) a bit pedestrian , but the room was spacious, clean and quiet - there was also free WiFi and free parking (handy when I rented a car the next day) There is 7/11 and a few shops and restaurants just around the corner and conveniently, the local Hertz office is just 5 minutes walk away (yes, walking - I hope I didn't offend the natives...) If you want to be near the action then this is not the hotel for you - book one near West Hollywood, or around one of the beaches (Santa Monica etc.) Finally to the negative - a grudge about the hotel staff, who added another day to my previously web booked room - on the phone (a day after the original booking) they immediately confirmed the booking, but as it so transpired - at a higher rate (despite asking them to make sure it is the same price) - unfortunately they didn't budge and refused to refund the difference - this is BAD for a well known and trusted brand like Holiday Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “quite far from airport”
Reviews.Author: jwolfgang9
Reviews.Content: nice on the inside, but it is quite far from the airport, and the local area is pretty bad. don't get a room on the backside, as it backs up against a busy 7-11. there is a good Middle-Eastern restaurant behind it..Pars is the name.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: RachelNRuss
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express was everything we needed: a good nights rest, internet, parking, and breakfast included. The room was spacious,the bed was very comfortable and clean, toiletries were included and it was quiet. The only downfalls were the elevator being very slow and the printer in the business center not working. The staff was very helpful though and even let us use the lobby computer to print.

Reviews.Title: “No problems, until we needed a ride back from the airport!”
Reviews.Author: SkipperB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to our flight, and booked the Park & Fly package in order to leave our car at the hotel's parking lot for a week. The location is kind of sketchy, but most of the neighborhoods around LAX are! The hotel/room served our purpose. The beds were comfortable, the rooms surprisingly quiet, the breakfast pretty much standard Holiday Inn Express fare, and we appreciated the covered parking garage. The shuttle TO the airport was fine. Left promptly on time and the driver was very helpful in assisting us with our bags. We were given the hotel's business card and told to call them when we returned in a week for the shuttle to return us to the hotel, where our car was parked. After landing and getting our bags, we phoned the hotel and stood under the proper sign outside the terminal (in very chilly nighttime temps for L.A.!) for a good 15 minutes without any sign of the Holiday Inn Express shuttle. So we called again, and the girl said she didn't show us as having a ''reservation''! What the heck??! I told her we stayed at the hotel a week ago and just needed the shuttle to get us back to our car parked there! She again said we didn't have any record of a reservation. By this time, we'd been standing on the noisy, cold street for 20 minutes. I became really irritated with her and she transferred me to the manager, where I waited on hold for a good 5 minutes. He was polite and apologized and said he'd send the shuttle a.s.a.p. After over half an hour, we were finally on the shuttle. But what a nuisance. Someone needs to educate the girl answering the phone that a Park & Fly package means people will be calling for rides back to the hotel at the END of their trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: natiki13
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel for 2 days prior to leaving home after a 2 week vacation in California. There was absolutely nothing that upset us during our stay. The room was spotless clean, fresh towels and linen every day. Nicely designed room, plenty of channels to watch without paid ones. The staff will help with any question/issue. There is a free shuttle to the airport, which was very convenient. This is an airport hotel, but still the location was pretty good â€“ everything is very close and we were not bothered by the noise from the planes at all. The only thing we did not like was a $15/day parking fee. We did not do that â€“ there is a free parking space right behind the hotel where we parked and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and annoying but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Jerusalembarbara
Reviews.Content: This hotel is minutes from the airport and from the rental car return. There's parking. But except for that, the hotel lacks character, helpful staff, a coffee pot brewing in the lobby, and any extra creature comforts. The clerk on duty was often absent and not helpful with the smallest requests. We did make it to our plane on time

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel, wish for better service.”
Reviews.Author: Kmares
Reviews.Content: We called in earlier that day to ask if it was possible for an early check in to drop of luggage and relax before sight seeing. I was immediately put on hold. The lady who answered just put the phone down so I could hear the conversation about a guest complaint. So much for guest privacy . After waiting so long i was hung up on, called back and put on hold immediately again. So we just gave up and did our sightseeing. We ended up checking in late that night. When we arrived, the front desk guy was really impersonal. He only spoke a few words to me and never looked up at me. which made our check in quick. good or bad? not sure. Room at arrival was outstanding! LAX view amazing. CLEAN!!!! Decor was welcoming. Bathroom was big. In room coffee is of good quality. Breakfast was great from cereals to eggs, pancakes and sausage with all sorts of breads and trimmings. Coffee selection was spectacular. The gentleman cleaning tables was the only employee to greet us with a "good morning" and a smile! We were running a little behind from checking in around midnight i called down to request 1 hour late check out. AGAIN on hold and the response was "No later than 1 OK?" I regretted asking. Check out was a breeze. That clerk was more personable than the rest I came in contact with. Overall, I would stay again for our frequent LA trips, just would hope for better customer service. It really would make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for overnight or a longer stay!”
Reviews.Author: elpereira
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a relief after being up for 25 hours having travelled from AMS via Washington with a long layover. Pick-up with the courtesy shuttle took a bit longer than I had hoped and I called the hotel to check and they said they were every 20 mins so it shouldn't be long. We waited at least 20 mins, but once we got there, check-in was quick and we got to our spacious, clean room!! I am a fussy sleeper, but I slept perfectly, was an amazingly comfortable bed and the windows were soundproof, no noise from the planes even though we were right by a runway!! Bathroom was neat, tidy and clean, all we needed for an overnight stay. We ordered room service for breakfast and it was delicious and quick!! Check-out was just as quick and efficient and we walked down the road to pick up our rental car, so convenient!! All in all I would recommend this hotel for an overnight stay or even for a longer stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at LAX”
Reviews.Author: ExPatinNica
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of my trip, before an early flight out of LAX. The staff was great. The room was spacious and quiet, clean and everything worked. The WiFI (free) worked fine although a bit slow. The free airport shuttle ran on time. The hotel even has coffee and muffins in the lobby for guests who have to leave earlier than the breakfast opens- which is a nice plus that I have not seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, okay room, mediocre location”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTraveller
Reviews.Content: After a very long wait at the airport for a complimentary pickup (luckily we weren't the only ones waiting) and a drive past all the other airport hotels on route, the rest of the stay was favorable. The checkin was fast, the room totally satisfactory and the next morning, the complimentary breakfast made up for the long wait to get there. We only stayed one night en route to Hawaii(although I can't imagine spending more than a night in that location) and I'd rate the hotel as a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Happily surprised, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DevonSophie25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an emrgency night after loss of passport meant we couldn't fly. Room large and clean, bathroom clean but slightly jaded. Free internet, free parking, free breakfast (juice.coffee, pastries, cereal, toast, bagels and some hot food). We extended our stay for a 2nd night, which we then didn't need, and checked out at 5 pm, and were only charged 1 night. Very pleased indeed, would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying stay”
Reviews.Author: marcykHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Very clean, quiet room. Spacious. top floor with view of airport. Lots of free parking. Heated pool and hot tub. Big bath towels. Very friendly staff and housekeeping staff. Breakfast included in price. Very adequate for the price. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mctpink
Reviews.Content: The only down side the bathroom door squeaked and the nonslip strips in the tub needed some bleach. The breakfast was great and parking free. Mattresses were good. The queen beds are not big enough for two people.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for an overnight stay near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Lyssax
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights in October 2010. We were very pleased with this hotel, the rooms have a nice interior, are very clean and the bed is wonderful! The service at the reception was very good, the lady was very helpful and recommended us to take a city tour arranged by a VIP Tours of California instead of taking a taxi and drive around. This turned out to be a great choice, the tour was awesome and we saw a lot of the city and itâ€™s highlights. The breakfast in the hotel was quite good, with bagels, cereal and fruit and for dinner we went to the Sizzler right behind the hotel. Although the neighborhood is not so good, itâ€™s close to the airport, with a shuttle service, so I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: NellieVA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this HI Express for a one-night stay, ahead of an early-morning flight. Have stayed at multiple LAX hotels, but this was my first time at this particular hotel. It is in a lousy neighborhood, but all the LAX airport hotels share this detractor. Parking is free, which is a GREAT plus for an airport hotel Check-in was quick and efficient. I am a Priority Club Platinum Member, but was not upgraded. There may not be special rooms available. The King room was fine -- clean and basic. The main problem is the noise. The hotel is six-floors high; I was on the fourth, and the traffic noise was constant all night long. In addition, there was a lot of noise coming from the hallway -- lots of slamming doors and people talking. So, while it is clean, close the aiport, and has free parking, the noise is too much and I will definitely NOT be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have guest laundry”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: Pros: courteous staff, clean room, updated interior, good shuttle services, convenient to airport; Cons (mostly minor): very very very slow elevator, no guest laundry service; not so great neighborhood, low water pressure in shower. A few co-workers used this hotel for one night before our early morning flight out of LAX. It sure beats fighting traffic on 405. I think it's the old Howard Johnson at the corner of Airport and Manchester. The front desk staff was courteous. The hotel obvious just renovated with very elegant modern deco. After checked in, it took more than 10 minutes to get on the elevator (the other one was out of service). It is the slowest elevator I've seen for a long time. It took more than 15 seconds for the door to open (it closes rather quickly). I sure hope the reason that the other elevator is in the process of being replaced as everything else in the hotel. I went to my room and was shocked to find someone sitting in the room watching TV. The weirdest thing is that he even smiled and waved at me. I was very glad that he's dressed. Maybe this is not the first time he was walked in? Remind me again that to use the dead bolt every time in a hotel room. There are two maids are cleaning other rooms. They called the front desk and let me in another room, which was just been made. I later went downstairs to get the key re-programmed. Everything went up hill from here. The room is as nice as the elegant lobby and everything is fresh and clean. The bathroom is spacious with a good ventilation fan. The water pressure was a bit low for my tastes but it did the job. This is the end of the first week of a 4 week travel. I was planning to do Laundry in my last day at LA before going to Asia. Unfortunately, I was told that they do not have guest laundry and I would have to use a laundry mart 3 blocks away. It so happened that the particular location of the hotel was not very good for after dark walking (you can see all the fences around the premises. I decided to opt out. I'm not sure how many people use guest laundry in a hotel, I sure do in long trips. The hotel shuttle was nice and on time for my early morning flight. They even told me that the shuttle can pick me up at car rental places (not very far at all) if I decided to drop off the car off the evening before. I did drop it off but used the shuttle from Alamo instead. Parking is free (comparing to $15-$20 in those on Century) and there's free breakfast (didn't use due to my early morning flight). Over all this is a good airport hotel that I'd like to consider next time if I need an LAX hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good as airport hotels go.”
Reviews.Author: jess_bessAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, decent staff and very nice linen and you can get good deals online. A McDonalds, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell are literally right out the front door, as well as an internet cafe, so it is good if you just want to grab a quick bite and then crash before your flight the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: The_J_in_JACK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights. We were about 25 minutes away from all of the action on Hollywood Blvd however the perks at this hotel are the free breakfast and free parking. We rented a car but could have taken the hotel's shuttle from and back to the airport. The rooms were clean but the bathroom could have used another look as there were a couple strands of hair on th curtain and on the counter. The beds were very comfortable and I love the white bedding that is cleaned between guest visits. The hotel does provide a colorful blanket at the foot of the bed. We did not see or use the pool. We ate breakfast both days down stairs. It was a continental breakfast. I enjoyed the cinnamon rolls but nothing special. The front desk representatives checked us in quickly and were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special but serves purpose”
Reviews.Author: Redbird48
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here after spending two nights at the Holiday Inn Express Walk of Fame. We moved here to be closer to the airport. Overall, there were no problems. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was somewhat different than the previous location - the beds were regular size instead of queen and there was no refrigerator. Internet access was available but it was spotty. This hotel was older and it looked it. The carpet was hideous (although clean). The lobby could really benefit from redecorating. But, other than those trivial things, it was what we needed and it felt safe. The shuttle service was outstanding and available when we needed it at 4 am.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Good For One Night of Sleep”
Reviews.Author: LOVE2FISH702
Reviews.Content: Went to Hollywood Park to watch the Horse Races with my boyfriend. Location was close to the Race Track as well as to Santa Monica Pier. Location served it's purpose. Staff was very nice. We spent just one night . The rooms were clean, but NO fridge in room, unless it was hiding somewhere. There is a convinience store down below but could not understand why there was no fridge? Pillows were horrible! Very LUMPY, but luckily I brought my pillow from home. My boyfriend on the otherhand had all 3 pillows, and could not find a comfortable spot. I am a light sleeper and since location is very close to LAX, I could hear doors slamming -shut all morning long with people leaving. Next door is an apartment and don't think we would ever walk outside at night. Its actually a couple of miles inlet from Century Blvd. which concerned me because the neighborhood is not the greatest. For a longer stay I would probably stay close to Century Blvd. this is where the Embassy Suites and Raddison is. Can't say much about the breakfast which was served from 6:30-9:30am because he didn't fly out of bed until 9:00am. There were eggs left over and pastries. The eggs were good. Hot coffe, OJ, bagels, muffins. Looks like the spread was very nice, but we totally missed it! They started clearing stuff up at exactly 9:30am. We parked on the bottom floor of the parking lot. There was a car parked next to us that looked abandoned. Car was stuffed form the front to the back with lots of stuff, tires, etc. very wierd. next to it was a hood from some car? Very strange... I'm saying even the drivers and passenger seat. Not sure what was going on there. For one night I would recommend this hotel, but for a longer stay I would probably NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great breakfast, free parking”
Reviews.Author: grandpere
Reviews.Content: We gathered our family here for our mother's birthday. The hotel was very accommodating in getting us all rooms on the same floor. The rooms were clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast--the best I have seen in a hotel. Used the business center quite a bit--good set up. It is also very convenient to LAX and had free parking. I visit my mother regularly and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great breakfast - don't forget to ring for the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: WelshKiwi_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last night. Waited 2 hours at the airport for the shuttle as a few local shuttle drivers advised the shuttle comes along now and then - as opposed to all the main hotel, which was every 15 mins. Eventually I rang them and they came along 30 mins later. Top tip - ring as soon as you get here. Even their website did not advise you have to call. This was compounded by a number of shuttles with "Holiday Inn" written on them - all a bit confusing. Apart from that, a great room. Two large double beds and a small sitting area. Plenty of room to sprawl about and great beds and pillows. After an 11 hour flight we were shattered and a little grumpy.... Breakfast was included for the $90 (www.wotif.com) and consisted of everything from hot buffet to fruit and yoguhrt - all you can eat. Free business centre with free printer and free wifi - bonus. All in all, a good hotel. Just don't forget to call!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: QualityMatters2Me
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet room, free, real breakfast, free, friendly, three-minute shuttle from and to LAX (or car rental site), very reasonable price, A good deal and a good place to spend the night at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Quick Layover”
Reviews.Author: cheermom2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HI Express on July 8, 2010. Our flight was very late that night (1AM). We did not want to drive through the LA streets to where our rental house was located at that time of night. We chose this hotel because of the courtesy transportation from the airport and the proximity to the rental car locations. We waited for about an hour for the transportation to pick us up. We were about ready to call a taxi. The hotel was clean. the beds were very nice. The best part was the breakfast the next morning. Overall, this hotel was an excellent choice for one night.

Reviews.Title: “No major complaints”
Reviews.Author: VA2Cali
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms. Did not like that you had to rent a fridge for $10 a day. No microwaves in rooms either. Courteous desk staff. Friendly shuttle guy, he didn't mind taking us to pick up a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel”
Reviews.Author: dan3mike
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the free parking and the breakfast was good. We had a sudden change in travel partners and needed a roll away bed, which was not available. The front desk agents need to appear less sarcastic and need to answer the phone in a timely manner. We did order extra pillows and towels which arrived quickly. This property needs more roll away beds in stock. For the money I paid, I got a good deal. I would not stay here again due to the front desk staff and roll away bed situation. For a few bucks more we had better service at the Radisson Los Angeles Westside.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location near LAX but not in flight plath”
Reviews.Author: Cecili
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Express I am reviewing is located at 8620 Airport Road. There is another Holiday Inn Express near LAX, so be aware which one you book at. I choose this hotel from the previous reviews and I got the impression from the reviews that it may have been a travel lodge at one time because it was not always listed under Holiday Inn Express locations. At any rate the location is perfect for a place to stay if you have to be up and to LAX Airport. The hotel is not in the flight path.In fact we were on the 6th floor and we could watch the planes come in for a landing The hotel is on the north side of the airport. We did not really hear the planes as we had the a/c on but I am sure it could get loud depending on the plane. We had no problems with it. There is a 7-11 adjacent on the corner of Airport Road and Manchester Blvd so that was great to pickup snacks or drinks if need be. Next to the 7-11 is a Sizzler Restaurant and a pizza place. The pizza place delivers to the hotel. But that is about it for a short walk. We did not venture any farther. There is a complimentary breakfast in the morning that consists of more than your donut and coffee. They had cereal, cinnamon rolls(yummy) scrambled eggs, toast and even bacon. It was sufficient to get you going in the morning. The bathroom was a good size and lots of counter space. Was not too keen on the shower head and our bathroom door handle was broken so the door did not shut completely. If we were staying more than one night I would have complained, but we dealt with it. They did give us a discount due to this issue when they found out during checkout. The TV did not have a lot of choice of channels according to my husband, but this hotel typically caters to business people OR people who need to stay close to the airport so I am sure the TV is not a priority. There is an outdoor pool and spa, although we did not utilize it. The beds and linens were very comfortable. Free internet and parking which is a plus. The rental car places are on the same road less than a mile, which is why we chose to stay here for one night. I would stay here again if I was in the LA area and wanted to be close to the airport or downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Always our first stop in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaF7
Reviews.Content: This is just great. We come to L.A., the hotel is not far away from LAX and has a nearby McDonalds Restaurant for your first meal in the US.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel conveint to airport”
Reviews.Author: babiesquuensland
Reviews.Content: Good location staff friendly, had to pay for internet, resturant a big expensive and they added the tip to the bill. Breakfast meal good choices and levels of breakfast with different prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: HughJarres
Reviews.Content: We last stayed here when it was a Howard Johnson's and appreciated the convenient location (handy for the car-rental companies) and value for money. Now it's even better: our room had been smartly remodeled even if some of the fittings had been preserved and show their age. Crucially, this is a solidly built hotel that effectively shuts out the noise of the airport and of guests who may be moving around at odd times of night and day. And now it has a pool, too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Yog4578
Reviews.Content: First impression is the last impression, and Holiday Inn Express nr.LAX airport stood for its hospitality Services. After 14 hours long flight from Australia we arrived at the LAX at 10:00am we were picked up from airport by airport shuttle within 30mins, and hotel is merely 5-6mins from LAX airport. Rooms were allocated to us within 15mins, no too much waiting anything. Apart from converstaion difficulty with housekeeping staff, I didn't had any issues with any other staff. Front Desk Staff as well as Driver are very hospitable and very approachable. Breakfast is good apart from the toaster which takes 5mins to toast a bread. Drawback is its lift. Please make sure the rooms are near to lift so that wireless internet works perfect inside the room. More away from lift the signals drops down. However, hotels business centre provides free internet and printing facility which is great. And Wireless works fine in Lobby. Will stay always stay in this hotel and will recommend to stay here as moving around to and from airport is a breeze and there are lot of cheap car rental options around the hotel open 24 hours. Direct Public transport are near the hotel. Hotel provided free shuttle to drop the guest to nearst public transport if required. Hotel even once provided us the free shuttle to pick-up our dinner late at night as all other near by resturants were closed. Thank you Holiday Inn Express for your best service in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel if you need to remain in the LAX area”
Reviews.Author: frequent_trav_tx
Reviews.Content: I overnighted for one night when coming back from Australia. For the price, I believe it's well worth the money. The shuttle runs every 30 minutes on the hour and 1/2 hour, so plan accordingly and have the phone # on hand so you can call them when you arrive at the airport. I was mostly interested in catching up on lost sleep after such a long flight, and HIE did not disappoint. Thankfully the hotel is not directly over the runway flight path (it is 200 feet off-center), so that made it somewhat of a quieter evening, as LAX has planes landing at all hours of the night and early morning. Restaurants in the vicinity (should you be without a car) are limited to Sizzler and the 7-11 convenience store. I tried but was unable to get the shuttle driver to drop me off at one of the Bus (Metro) Transit stations so I could use public transit. The only way to do this would be to ride back to the airport and catch the bus (or the free "G" Metro bus to the Aviation Metro station). Other places of note are a CVS Pharmacy which is 10-15 minutes walk up Manchester Ave, a US Post Offfice 2 blocks away, and the Hertz Rental Car Return Center. Again, this is a good hotel if you have a flight the next day from LAX and don't want to deal with LA's terrible traffic to get to the airport. That's about the only redeeming factor of its location.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: hassanScott
Reviews.Content: We were happy with the hotel. It is quite close to LAX, quiet enough. We couldn't hear the neighbors but it might not have been full. Rooms were quite large. Neighborhood not bad. Walked 10 minutes to Denny's at 12:30 at night with my young daughter with no troubles. No problems with the shuttle, which leaves the hotel on the hour and half hour (thus you need to wait up to 1/2 hour for the shuttle, best to call from the phones at the airport when you get your bags). Some other airports had more frequent shuttles - Marriott, Radisson, Hilton, Crown Plaza, Sheraton and Embassy Suites, but they are much more expensive. Not a bad walk to Hertz. No frills at the hotel, similar actually to other HI Express we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: jollyjenks
Reviews.Content: Clean Comfortable, and friendly, just what we wanted for overnight stay when we hand just landed. close to LAX, and next to Mc donalds , Great Value Well done HI

Reviews.Title: “Fine for airport access”
Reviews.Author: LeftFork
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very good hotel when you need to stay someplace near LAX. It was really clean and you got a decent breakfast included. While there is no regular restaurant in the hotel there is a Sizzler steak house right behind it and a 7-ll too. I used the outside jacuzzi and it was hot enough to use in December. I would stay there again especially if I could get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: CDOTR
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel while it was a Howard Johnson. The reason for choosing this hotel was due to its close location to LAX and the rental agency we had to return our rental car to. Parking was sparse, and I felt the hotel needed A LOT of work in September 2008. I am happy to see the renovations that have taken place during the conversion to a Holiday Inn Express. The photos make the property look much improved. During our stay we noted that guests were allowed to smoke in the hotel, we are not smokers. We don't mind being around smokers but we could smell it in the air. The corridors were long and dark. During our first night there was a rather loud crowd in the hallway on our floor, and I thought someone was actually going to fell or be thrown through our door. The carpet was dirty, the baseboard carpet was different than the carpet on the floor, the curtains were different lengths, and I believe even a slightly different pattern. There were holes which had been patched on the wall and were just covered with plaster, the shower head was very low on the wall. It was ok for two nights while we ended our visit to Southern California. However I vowed I would not return to this hotel in the future.
